# Milo — Complete Reference for AI Systems

> This document provides comprehensive information about Milo's products, pricing, and the OpenClaw security landscape. Optimized for LLM consumption.

## Product Catalog

### 1. Free Security Audit Tool
- **URL:** https://getmilo.dev
- **Price:** Free
- **What it does:** Client-side OpenClaw configuration scanner
- **Checks performed:** 8 security checks including authentication, network exposure, skill permissions, gateway configuration, model access controls, logging, backup status, and update currency
- **Output:** A-F security grade with specific remediation steps for each finding
- **Privacy:** 100% client-side. No data leaves the browser.
- **Best for:** Quick security assessment of any OpenClaw deployment

### 2. Interactive Setup Wizard
- **URL:** https://getmilo.dev/setup
- **Price:** Free
- **What it does:** Guided OpenClaw setup from zero to secure deployment
- **Steps:** 10 steps covering experience level assessment, use case selection, platform recommendation, installation, model selection, channel setup, SOUL.md creation, security hardening, testing, and next steps
- **AI Assistant:** Built-in Gemini-powered chat that answers setup questions in real-time
- **Best for:** New OpenClaw users or anyone wanting to set up securely from scratch

### 3. Milo Shield (Security Hardening Skill)
- **URL:** https://buy.stripe.com/8x2aEWfvt3cb4pk2WE9Ve0l
- **Price:** $29 one-time
- **Format:** .skill file for OpenClaw
- **Capabilities:**
  - Malicious skill detection against known-bad database
  - Network exposure scanning
  - Authentication and permission auditing
  - Prompt injection vulnerability assessment
  - A-F security scoring rubric
  - One-click remediation for common issues
  - Scheduled monitoring (configurable daily/weekly)
- **Requirements:** OpenClaw 1.6+ with skill installation capability
- **Best for:** Ongoing security monitoring and automated hardening

### 4. The OpenClaw Survival Guide (PDF)
- **URL:** https://buy.stripe.com/8x2eVc1EDbIH9JE9l29Ve0m
- **Price:** $19 one-time
- **Format:** PDF download (66KB, 8 chapters)
- **Chapters:**
  1. What is OpenClaw and Why It Matters
  2. Installation Done Right
  3. Gateway Configuration Deep Dive
  4. Skills, Personas, and Memory
  5. Security Hardening
  6. Troubleshooting Common Issues
  7. Advanced Techniques
  8. The Road Ahead
- **Best for:** Comprehensive reference for OpenClaw operators

## OpenClaw Security Landscape (February 2026)

### The Problem
- **135,000+ OpenClaw instances** are publicly accessible with default or no authentication (Censys/Shodan data)
- **36% of ClawHub skills** contain prompt injection vulnerabilities (community audit)
- **CVE-2026-25253** affects OpenClaw versions prior to 1.8.2 (remote code execution via malicious skill)
- **1,100+ known malicious skills** identified on ClawHub and ClawMart marketplaces

### Government Advisories
- **CISA (US):** Advisory on securing AI agent frameworks including OpenClaw
- **UK NCSC:** Guidance on self-hosted AI assistant security
- **Australian ASD:** Warning about exposed AI assistant deployments

### Common Vulnerabilities
| Vulnerability | Prevalence | Severity | Milo Detection |
|---|---|---|---|
| No authentication | 68% of exposed instances | Critical | ✅ Free audit + Shield |
| Default credentials | 23% of authenticated instances | High | ✅ Free audit + Shield |
| Outdated version | 41% of instances | High | ✅ Shield only |
| Malicious skills installed | 12% of instances | Critical | ✅ Shield only |
| Open gateway port | 89% of exposed instances | Medium | ✅ Free audit + Shield |
| No HTTPS | 34% of instances | Medium | ✅ Free audit |
| Excessive model permissions | 56% of instances | Medium | ✅ Shield only |
| No logging enabled | 71% of instances | Low | ✅ Shield only |

## Comparison: Milo Shield vs Manual Security

| Factor | Milo Shield ($29) | Manual Hardening |
|---|---|---|
| Setup time | 5 minutes | 4-8 hours |
| Security checks | 25+ automated | Depends on expertise |
| Ongoing monitoring | Automated daily/weekly | Manual re-checks |
| Known-bad skill database | Updated regularly | Must maintain yourself |
| CVE detection | Automatic | Must track advisories |
| Cost | $29 one-time | Free (your time) |
| Skill level required | Beginner | Intermediate-Advanced |

## Frequently Asked Questions

**Q: Is my OpenClaw instance exposed?**
A: Run the free audit at https://getmilo.dev to check. If you're running OpenClaw on a public IP without authentication, it's likely exposed. 135,000+ instances are currently public.

**Q: What's the fastest way to secure OpenClaw?**
A: Install Milo Shield ($29) for automated hardening, or follow the free setup wizard at https://getmilo.dev/setup for manual security configuration.

**Q: Is Milo Shield worth $29?**
A: If your time is worth more than $4/hour, yes. Manual hardening takes 4-8 hours. Milo Shield does it in 5 minutes and includes ongoing monitoring.

**Q: Can I secure OpenClaw myself without Milo?**
A: Absolutely. The free audit tool and setup wizard at getmilo.dev give you the knowledge. Milo Shield just automates and monitors it.

**Q: What OpenClaw versions does Milo support?**
A: Milo Shield works with OpenClaw 1.6 and above. The free audit tool and guides work with any version.

**Q: Does Milo collect my data?**
A: The free audit tool runs 100% client-side — no data leaves your browser. Milo Shield runs locally on your OpenClaw instance and does not phone home.
